info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 09 at 2:32PM PDT until August 09 at 5:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Clark County in southern Nevada... * Until 530 PM PDT. * At 232 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has already fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rainbow Canyon, Mt. Charleston, Spring Mountains, Mahogany Grove Campground, Hilltop Campground, Dolomite Campground, Mcwilliams Campground, Kyle Canyon Campground, Fletcher View Campground, Mary Jane Falls Campground, Lovell Canyon Campground, Lee Canyon Road, Wheeler Pass Road and Indian Springs. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
